1341497527120498689.text:
As always, I will continue to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle & put Ohioans first. These bills are necessary for Ohioans' wellbeing, which is why I’m pleased they passed both chambers of Congress.
 
I encourage the President to sign this into law swiftly.

1341497393787760640.text:
Let’s be clear: these were 2 independent pieces of essential legislation combined into 1 package for expediency.
 
The games and process set by Speaker Pelosi leading up to the passage of this legislation was unacceptable and set Americans back when they needed our help the most.

1341497260815740928.text:
-Support for rural and underserved health care

-Major investments in rural broadband

-Workforce development programs

-Key energy priorities such as ending reliance on critical minerals from foreign countries

-Continued support for our foreign allies

1341497060076478465.text:
Some of those appropriations items include:
 
-Providing our military resources they need to defend our country

-Ending surprise medical billing

-Funding community health centers and other public health programs

-Supporting front line health care workers

1341496882648895488.text:
While this package will provide critical COVID relief for Americans, it also includes a fundamental part of Congress’ job: appropriations.
 
This is a key responsibility of Congress every year.
 
This is how we keep essential government programs, agencies, and functions running.

1341496717384925185.text:
However, the resulting legislation includes several wins for Ohioans.
 
Most of this COVID funding was repurposed, not new spending.
 
LEARN MORE about my top priorities that were included in the major COVID relief portion of the bill: https://t.co/nEeeTCzKEU https://t.co/4TCjK9eDjZ

1341496560195014656.text:
This time last week Congress needed to pass 2 major pieces of legislation: 1 to fund the govt & another to provide COVID relief to Americans.
 
Last night we did that by combining the 2 pieces into 1 package. The process to get to this point frustrated me & put Americans at risk.

1341214014664269825.text: While long overdue, this legislation does exactly what it needs to do: provide major, critical relief to Ohio’s families, small business employees, rural communities, agriculture sector, and more. While I’m pleased my colleagues on both sides of the aisle have finally… (1/2)

1341107054417567745.text:
Among other items that will help Ohioans are additional funds for testing and vaccines, telehealth, substance abuse programs, housing assistance, rural broadband expansion, SNAP, and a program that helps Ohio’s ag. community.

Next step, it’s time for us to get this passed!

1341107053717192704.text: Notably, this bill also gives #SmallBusinesses the ability to deduct PPP grants from 2020 taxes — another big win in the fight to restore America’s #SmallBiz economy and secure future jobs. My colleagues and I pushed hard for this, so I’m pleased it is included in the final bill.

1341107053062844417.text: While I wish it had come sooner, I’m glad Congress has agreed on a targeted COVID relief bill that’ll help struggling Ohioans. It provides a round of direct payments for both adults & dependents, reopens the small business Paycheck Protection Program, helps schools reopen & more.

1340025556784488448.text:
One week until Christmas.  

Still no relief deal for Americans.  

We can't agree on everything, so let's pass the pieces of the puzzle we do agree on.  

Getting something done while we continue to iron out the details is better than stalling over a few disagreements.

1339704496713134080.text: I urge my colleagues on both sides to come to the table to reach an agreement swiftly. Let’s do the job we were elected to do and fight for the wellbeing of the American people.

1339704495773650945.text: We will never agree on everything – and that’s okay. Let’s focus on what we do agree on, because there is more of that than most people realize. Negotiations have fizzled over a few agenda items, but there’s so much we can accomplish right now if we commit ourselves to doing it.

1339704494808989696.text: These are real people’s lives and livelihoods that are on the line. They are counting on us to get this done, and get it done quickly. This holiday season will be different – that much is for sure. But we can offer a glimmer of hope by passing a relief package ASAP.

1339704493626150914.text: We’re talking about the single mother in Worthington who was laid off in April and isn’t sure how she’ll put presents under the tree for her two children. We’re talking about the 80-year-old couple in Newark who still hasn’t been able to meet their newborn grandchild.

1339704492674019329.text: This may be one of the most difficult holiday seasons many Ohioans will ever face. Even with the optimism that vaccines provide, relief packages have stalled since summer due to partisan disputes. What some of my colleagues don't realize is we aren’t talking in hypotheticals.

1333773729478942722.text: Enough is enough. We cannot continue down this path without resolutions. It’s time to reach a deal and help the people who elected us.

1333773619562942467.text: I have spoken with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle and we share a common goal: getting Americans and the small businesses that move our economy forward relief. It’s past time to come to the table and create a bipartisan roadmap to achieve this goal.

1333773389346074632.text: We’ve put trillions of dollars toward helping hospitals, small businesses, local governments, and most importantly, the people of this nation. But Congress hasn’t taken any steps forward in months.

1333773267241476097.text: We’ve received lots of positive news about impending vaccines—a step in the right direction that I’m excited about. Some of the research that made these vaccines possible came from funding made available by Congress earlier this year.
